Counseling  either one-on-one or in groups  can help develop skills to stop or reduce drinking, develop reachable goals, manage the triggers that lead to alcohol misuse and build a strong social support system that supports healthy habits. There are many kinds of counseling approaches. - cognitive behavior therapy   - motivational enhancement therapy  - marital and family counseling  - brief interventions cognitive behavior therapy motivational
